ARTICLE.TITLE: Shocking true story of The Great Heist on Netflix when thieves stole £26million
ARTICLE.TEXT:
Sign up to FREE email alerts from Mirror - celebs Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Invalid Email

Netflix has released its latest original series, a Colombian drama about a high stakes bank robbery.

The Great Heist, also known as ‘El Robo Del Siglo’, has been available to watch worldwide since August 14.

The series is inspired by real events that unfolded in Colombia in 1994, which went on to be known as the robbery of the century.

The Netflix series also reportedly takes inspiration from a book by Alfredo Serrano Zabala, called ‘This is How I Robbed the Bank: The Assault of the 20th Century in Colombia.’

But what are the true events behind the inspiration for Netflix’s The Great Heist?

The heist

(Image: Netflix)

The series chronicles the robbery of Colombia’s central bank in October 1994, that saw 24 billion Colombian pesos (£26 million) stolen by skilled thieves.

In October 1994, a group of 14 men entered Colombia's Banco de la Republica in the city of Valledupar, walking easily and unchallenged through the front door.

The men entered the building under the guise of carrying out air conditioning maintenance, and took advantage of the fact that the Monday was a national holiday.

Over a period of 21 hours the thieves were able to successfully carry out the heist without alerting the authorities.

During this time the thieves used a variety of tools, masks, welding machines and oxygen tanks to access the bank's vault and help themselves to the money.

The most notable aspect of this robbery was that such a significant amount of money was stolen without a single shot being fired by the thieves. They were in and out without anyone even noticing.

The professional operation was reportedly planned for almost eight months, where the thieves studied the electronic security system, and imported specialised machinery from Canada to complete the heist.

The robbers

(Image: Netflix)

The successful operation was no fluke, but instead a carefully planned operation carried out by skilled specialists.

The team of thieves was made up of established robbers, electronics specialists, members of the police force and even officials from the bank itself.

Authorities estimate around 26 people were involved either directly or indirectly in what is now referred to as the robbery of the century.

The aftermath

(Image: Netflix)

After the robbery, Colombia’s national bank offered a reward for information leading to the capture of the culprits.

The suspected mastermind behind the robbery, Jaime Bonilla Esquivel, eventually handed himself in to authorities.

It was reported that Bonilla handed himself in after receiving death threats from police, who threatened to kill him if he turned them in.

At the time of his arrest he was carrying 200 million Colombian pesos of the stolen money.

The heist caused financial havoc in northern Colombia as businesses were required to lookout for the serial numbers of the missing money.

The stolen money consisted of all new bills that were not yet meant to be in circulation, and led to the discontinuation of many bank notes.

All six episodes of The Great Heist are available to watch on Netflix worldwide from Friday August 14.

METADATA.description: The Great Heist is Netflix's new true crime mini-series. The drama tells the story of a crime dubbed 'the robbery of the century', when a gang of thieves stole £26million from a branch of Colombia's national bank
METADATA.author: Ella Bennett
